intro: Dianthoseris, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow or orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Dianthoseris species are often used in xeriscaping due to their low water requirements and ornamental value. They play a role in supporting local pollinators and contribute to the ecological diversity of their native habitats.
